page.title: 01Embsay with Eastby
page.content: Embsay with Eastby is a township in the parish of Skipton in the craven district of the county of North Yorkshire. Spared from large scale housing or industrial development, the parish is situated between the grouse moors of Barden to the North and the limestone Bank of Haw park to the South. The rocky outcrop of Embsay Cra stands out from the Moor to the West. A similar outcrop, Eatby Crag, is set above the village to the East. The road through the village is the boundary of the National Park and leads in the direction of Barden to a height of about 340 metres at park top. A mill producing synthetic fibre, a tannery and a quarry provide local employment outside agriculture. Sheep and cattle graze the moors and farms are predominantly concerned with rearing livestock.
